fields.summary: ELB fails to create when one out of multiple AZs is 100% utilized

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Noticed on cloud with 4 AZs. We use CF to deploy some autoscaling groups, and CF uses the GetAZs function to deploy instances across all AZs of the cloud. The min size of all ASG is 1, and desired is 1, which means that the cloud has to satisfy to have at least 1 instance in the ASG to be healthy.

The list of AZs looks like : region-1a, region-1b, region-1c, region-1d (in that specific order)

If there is capacity in AZ 1a, instance(s) will be created as expected. But in the occasion that the cluster 1a has no capacity left to create the instance, instead of trying in another AZ, as specified in the ASG definition (4AZs) it continuously tries and fails to spin it up in AZ 1A. 

Expected behaviour is for the ASG to create an instance in any AZ that has the capacity to run it.

Also, AWS behaviour generally speaking is to deploy instances in a random manner to the ASG, not sequentially.

To replicate : create a cloud with multi AZ (3 would help represent the problem properly).
Put 1 NC per zone, and full the first zone. Then, create an ASG with the 3 zones, the first zone being the full one. ASG min =1, max =1, desired =1 . You will realize that no instance is created in zone A, as there isnt room for it, but neither in any other.
fields.summary: ASG fails to distribute instances across AZ in some cases

comments.body: Do the failures to run instances appear in euscale-describe-scaling-activities output?

We can fix this by having CLC round-robin across AZs.

[~tony] - let's test this behavior specifically.

We will now select from the candidate zones randomly when there are multiple zones with an equivalent number of instances. When a zone has no capacity you will see scaling activity such as:

{code}
#
#
# euscale-describe-scaling-activities -g group-2 
ACTIVITY	0f85c84d-e0ae-4162-b2c4-0c127d095b8e	2016-10-25T06:47:35.280Z	group-2	Successful	
ACTIVITY	6acac083-e029-4b64-a69c-642b77257e60	2016-10-25T06:46:55.210Z	group-2	Failed	Not enough resources (0 in one < 1): vm instances.
ACTIVITY	659947f2-d1bc-4a9c-9f87-94a304ae8d8e	2016-10-25T06:46:35.193Z	group-2	Failed	Not enough resources (0 in one < 1): vm instances.
ACTIVITY	edfa9c39-7137-4590-8aed-c364d414a2fe	2016-10-25T06:46:25.178Z	group-2	Failed	Not enough resources (0 in one < 1): vm instances.
#
#
{code}

so some launch failures can occur but retries may use different zones and succeed.

This fix does not allow zones to become unbalanced, so it is still possible for a group to be failing to launch instances when one zone is out of capacity. It is not generally expected that autoscaling will work well when attempting to use zones that are not able to run instances due to resource constraints.

*Eucalyptus Version*

{{4.4.0-0.25788.147.20170202git6e5a63d.el7}}

*Steps*

# Create Eucalyptus VPC cloud with multiple availability zones - [hspencer-400-maint-4.4|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint_4.4/400/]
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# euca-describe-availability-zones --region euca-admin@
AVAILABILITYZONE	black-dollar	available
AVAILABILITYZONE	black-market	available
AVAILABILITYZONE	port-of-miami	available
{code}
# Create non-eucalyptus account (example {{development-operations}}) via {{euare-accountcreate}}
# Using other cloud accounts, use up all the resources under one availability zone:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# euca-describe-instance-types --show-capacity --by-zone --region euca-admin@
AVAILABILITYZONE	black-dollar

INSTANCETYPE	m3.2xlarge      4          4096          30     4     3 /     3    100%
INSTANCETYPE	cc1.4xlarge     8          3072          60     4     2 /     2    100%
INSTANCETYPE	m2.4xlarge      8          4096          60     8     2 /     2    100%
INSTANCETYPE	hi1.4xlarge     8          6144         120     8     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	cc2.8xlarge    16          6144         120     8     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	cg1.4xlarge    16         12288         200     8     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	cr1.8xlarge    16         16384         240     8     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	hs1.8xlarge    48        119808       24000     8     0 /     0

AVAILABILITYZONE	black-market
INSTANCETYPE	Name         CPUs  Memory (MiB)  Disk (GiB)  NICs  Used / Total  Used %
INSTANCETYPE	m1.small        1           256           5     2    24 /    24    100%
INSTANCETYPE	t1.micro        1           256           5     2    24 /    24    100%
INSTANCETYPE	m1.medium       1           512          10     2    12 /    12    100%
INSTANCETYPE	c1.medium       2           512          10     2    12 /    12    100%
INSTANCETYPE	m1.large        2           512          10     3    12 /    12    100%
INSTANCETYPE	m1.xlarge       2          1024          10     4    12 /    12    100%

INSTANCETYPE	m3.xlarge       4          2048          15     4     6 /     6    100%
INSTANCETYPE	m2.2xlarge      2          4096          30     4     2 /     2    100%
INSTANCETYPE	m3.2xlarge      4          4096          30     4     2 /     2    100%
INSTANCETYPE	cc1.4xlarge     8          3072          60     4     2 /     2    100%
INSTANCETYPE	m2.4xlarge      8          4096          60     8     2 /     2    100%
INSTANCETYPE	hi1.4xlarge     8          6144         120     8     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	cc2.8xlarge    16          6144         120     8     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	cg1.4xlarge    16         12288         200     8     0 /     0

AVAILABILITYZONE	port-of-miami
INSTANCETYPE	Name         CPUs  Memory (MiB)  Disk (GiB)  NICs  Used / Total  Used %
INSTANCETYPE	m1.small        1           256           5     2    15 /    24     62%
INSTANCETYPE	t1.micro        1           256           5     2    15 /    24     62%
INSTANCETYPE	m1.medium       1           512          10     2     8 /    12     67%
INSTANCETYPE	c1.medium       2           512          10     2     8 /    12     67%
INSTANCETYPE	m1.large        2           512          10     3     8 /    12     67%
INSTANCETYPE	m1.xlarge       2          1024          10     4     8 /    12     67%
INSTANCETYPE	c1.xlarge       2          2048          10     4     2 /     6     33%
INSTANCETYPE	m2.xlarge       2          2048          10     4     2 /     6     33%
INSTANCETYPE	m3.xlarge       4          2048          15     4     4 /     6     67%
INSTANCETYPE	m2.2xlarge      2          4096          30     4     2 /     2    100%

INSTANCETYPE	cc1.4xlarge     8          3072          60     4     2 /     2    100%

{code}
# Using linked {{cfn-asg-multiaz-vpc-template.json}} template, deploy stack that spans all three availability zones:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# euform-create-stack ASGTest --template-file cfn-asg-multiaz-vpc-template.json --capabilities CAPABILITY_IAM --parameter ImageId=emi-63ef779d --parameter KeyName=devops-admin --parameter EndPoint=http://cloudformation.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ --parameter MinSize=3 --parameter MaxSize=6 --region devops-admin@
arn:aws:cloudformation::000727120439:stack/ASGTest/b8b7097f-8d94-49d8-9e5a-dac346c75c3b
[root@h-04 ~]# euform-describe-stacks ASGTest --region devops-admin@
STACK	ASGTest	CREATE_COMPLETE		CloudFormation template to deploy Auto Scaling Group in multiple AZs on Eucalyptus VPC cloud	2017-02-15T16:45:54.502Z
PARAMETER	ImageId		emi-63ef779d
PARAMETER	KeyName		devops-admin
PARAMETER	EndPoint		http://cloudformation.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
PARAMETER	InstanceType		m1.medium
PARAMETER	MinSize		3
PARAMETER	MaxSize		6
OUTPUT	AutoScalingGroup	ASGTest-AutoScalingGroup-RMYRXXQS8OO64
{code}
# Confirm ASG is present in two of the three AZs:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups ASGTest-AutoScalingGroup-RMYRXXQS8OO64 --region devops-admin@
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	ASGTest-AutoScalingGroup-RMYRXXQS8OO64	ASGTest-LaunchConfig-5MI584JEPLXMS	black-market,black-dollar,port-of-miami		3	6	3	Default

[root@h-04 ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups ASGTest-AutoScalingGroup-RMYRXXQS8OO64 --region devops-admin@
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	ASGTest-AutoScalingGroup-RMYRXXQS8OO64	ASGTest-LaunchConfig-5MI584JEPLXMS	black-market,black-dollar,port-of-miami		3	6	3	Default
INSTANCE	i-c3caefc9	black-dollar	InService	Healthy	ASGTest-LaunchConfig-5MI584JEPLXMS
INSTANCE	i-05d6b7f3	port-of-miami	InService	Healthy	ASGTest-LaunchConfig-5MI584JEPLXMS
TAG	auto-scaling-group	ASGTest-AutoScalingGroup-RMYRXXQS8OO64	Name	ASGTest	true
TAG	auto-scaling-group	ASGTest-AutoScalingGroup-RMYRXXQS8OO64	aws:cloudformation:logical-id	AutoScalingGroup	true
TAG	auto-scaling-group	ASGTest-AutoScalingGroup-RMYRXXQS8OO64	aws:cloudformation:stack-id	arn:aws:cloudformation::000727120439:stack/ASGTest/b8b7097f-8d94-49d8-9e5a-dac346c75c3b	true

{code}
# Free up resources on the AZ that was at 100% capacity
# Re-check ASG to confirm it scaled in that AZ:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups ASGTest-AutoScalingGroup-RMYRXXQS8OO64 --region devops-admin@
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	ASGTest-AutoScalingGroup-RMYRXXQS8OO64	ASGTest-LaunchConfig-5MI584JEPLXMS	black-market,black-dollar,port-of-miami		3	6	3	Default

{code}
